online_workflow_manager module¶

class online_workflow_manager.MyFormatter(fmt=None, datefmt=None)[source]¶

Bases: logging.Formatter

Formats logs with particular time-stamps.

converter()¶

timestamp[, tz] -> tz’s local time from POSIX timestamp.

formatTime(record, datefmt=None)[source]¶
class online_workflow_manager.WorkflowManager(user, password, upr_url, spm_url, ned_ID, debug=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

DEBUG = False¶
M2L(upr_url, spm_url, service_graph_xml, mspl_list_xml, user, password, editor_id)[source]¶

High-level function which translates the MSPL rules into low-level configurations. User is the username of the user. Password is the token of the user. Editor_id is the username of the user who created the policy. MSPL_list_xml is an XML list of MSPL rules which is returned by the SPM H2M service.

dbprint(string)[source]¶

Debug function. When enabled produces more verbose logs.

delete_all_rec_mspl(user, password, upr_url)[source]¶

Deletes old reconciled MSPLs which are no longer valid. User Profile Repository (UPR) must be specified as well as the access token.

get_PolicyStack(user, upr, cooperative, coop, uncoop)[source]¶

Get the policy stack of a particular user.

get_capability_from_mspl(mspl)[source]¶

Parse a specific MSPL and return a list of capabilities that are discovered inside

get_creator(user, upr)[source]¶

Get the administrator who created a given user

init_log()[source]¶

Initialises logger and logs to a file called WFM.log

reconcile(user, password, upr_url, spm_url, ned_ID)[source]¶

Function which gets all the users associated to a particular user (e.g. stakedholders like parent, ISP, country) and identify which policies are co-operative and non-co-operative. If successful, a reconciled application/service graph is produced and stored in the user’s profile.

spm_reconcile(spm_url, rec_input)[source]¶

Low-level auxiliary function which calls the SPM reconciliation service.

translate(spm_url, mspl, psaID)[source]¶

Low-level auxiliary function which translates a single MSPL rule into a specific PSA configuration, where PSA ID is the name of the PSA.

online_workflow_manager.main()[source]¶

Invoked when run manually from the command line
